author: nero_eth
content:
Would  be grateful if some Engine API pro could have a look at my EIP-7928 (Block-level Acccess Lists) spec changes:
https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/compare/master...nerolation:toni-consensus-specs:eip7928-block-access-lists

author: m.kalinin
content: I don't see any changes that would affect Engine API. I think it is better to use the `block_access_list_root` field name instead of `block_access_list_hash`. Other than that the changes to the spec look good

author: nero_eth
content: Yeah right. The only change is essentially to pass the block access list to the EL. I used `hash` as it's a keccak hash (we moved away from ssz).

author: m.kalinin
content: oh, then this field should rather have `Hash32` type and I also see that `hash_tree_root` is used to compute its value, not keccak

author: nero_eth
content: Ah good call, it's not yet updated to reflect the changes moving to rlp
